title: Intermediate English 310
headline: Master the vocabulary around service providers and learn about direct and indirect speech in this free online course.
description: This course introduces you to the vocabulary related to people and places that provide services. You will discover the differences between causative and passive causative verbs and understand how to use them when forming questions. You will also learn how to write sentences in direct and indirect speech and explore how they change when written in the present simple and past simple tenses. Enroll in this course, and start learning today!
courseDescription:
In this course, you will delve into the English language learning new words and phrases to enhance your language proficiency. We will first introduce you to the vocabulary related to typical service providers used in everyday life and identify the services offered by each of these providers.

Once familiar with the terminology, you will delve into two main grammar topics. The first grammar point will start by helping you master causative and passive causative verbs, focusing on how to use these verbs when forming questions. You will also compare how to use words such as 'get' and 'have' as causative and passive causative verbs. In the second grammar section, you will learn more about writing sentences in direct and indirect speech and examine the changes needed when these sentences are written in the present simple and past simple tenses.

This course will allow you to explore and complete activities to enhance your English reading, listening, and speaking skills. In addition, you will find a downloadable writing task in this course's 'Resources' section, which will guide you in improving your writing skills. Enroll today to take another step forward in becoming proficient in this universal language.
